newsitem.title: USA: Tellabs to supply CDMA system in Beijing.
newsitem.headline: Tellabs to supply CDMA system in Beijing.

text.p: Tellabs Inc said Thursday it has won a contract to supply its MartisDXX managed access and transport network system to the Beijing Telecom Great Wall Mobile Network.
Terms of the deal were not disclosed.

The network is based on code division multiple access (CDMA) technology for wireless phone systems and is expected to enter commercial service towards the end of 1997, Tellabs said. The system gives users greater wireless phone network capacity from a relatively small number of base stations.

"This contract marks a double first for Tellabs," said Ray Cheung, Tellabs vice president of Asia Pacific. "Not only is it Tellabs' first MartisDXX system win in China, it is also the first time the system has been commercially deployed in a CDMA network."
Beijing Telecom Great Wall Mobile Network is a cooperative network that will deliver cellular services in Beijing.
Tellabs provides voice and data transport and network access systems.
